title.narrative: YSAD- No Dey Give; Follow Traffic Rules

description.narrative:
This action is being led by a consortium of Youth and students advocates for development initiative, The People’s Conscience and Eagle Post. “No Dey Give; Follow Traffic Rules” project aims to raise citizens’ awareness on the menace of extortion of Nigerians by the police <(>&<)> how it is connected with police brutality and galvanize citizens to move from bystanders to activists against extortion of road users by the police and sustain the call for increased welfare and funding of the police.
The project will carry outthe following actions to achieve these goals: ● Carry out strategic advocacy visits. ● Engage relevant stakeholders through dialogue. ● Carry out sensitization workshops for road transport workers. ● Embark on motor parks outreaches. ●Radio talk shows and jingles. ● Establish a public complaint log.
Through the above actions the project is expected to yield the following results: ● Increasednumber of citizens who are aware of the link between extortion and police brutality and join in the fight against extortion and brutality. ● Increased number of citizens who obey traffic rules. ● Increased number of citizens who fight against extortion and advocate for improved welfare of the police and police accountability.

participating-org.narrative:
The actors involved are: Youth and students advocates for development initiative, The People’s Conscience and Eagle Post.
Youth and Students Advocates for Development Initiative started as a student organization at the University of Nigeria, Nsukka (South east Nigeria). It was incorporated by the Corporate Affairs Commission in November 2010. The organization is concerned with building networks and social movements that will usher in the much desired social change in Nigeria through advocacy, trainings, public awareness programmes, research, dialogue and public interest litigations. Over the years, YSAD INITIATIVE has taken some bold steps towards nation building. We have featured severally on 'Bridges,' an NTA Network Talk Show discussing issues of national importance. YSAD Initiative has also been a voice against extortion and police brutality in Nigeria. Before the eruption of the ENDSARS protest, YSAD hadwritten to the Nigerian President on the issue of widespread extortion with impunity on Nigerian roads demanding that the IGP be relieved of his appointment to serve as a deterrent to the Police Force.
The People’s Conscience is a credible print media with bias for courageous and objective journalism. It is a bi-weekly tabloid based in south east and covers news events in the zone and beyond.
Eaglepost on the other hand is a blog that promotes socio-political and economic awareness using the tools of modern information dissemination. It has its focus mainly on south east Nigeria, especiallyAbia and Anambra states. EaglePost is on a mission to enlighten, update and bring to the consciousness of its audience, the importance of getting involved in public affairs, fighting injustice, believing in themselves and never to give up irrespective ofwhat obtains presently.
Their links with south east Nigeria and individual past experiences on the activities of the police and other law enforcement agents in the zone, individual desire for orderliness and the need to enlighten citizens is where ourpriorities and objectives overlap. They believe that working together on this project will enable them take advantage of their individual experiences and strengths to contribute towards addressing the issues raisedby ENDSARS protest and make the societybetter
